title: Romantic Valentine proposal single-page with evasive No button and meme reveal

requirements.text: Create a single, simple romantic-themed page addressed to “Aqsa Kousar” that asks: “Will you be my Valentine?” and presents exactly two options: “Yes” and “No”.

quotes:
Create an interactive web page as a surprise for my girlfriend aqsa kousar.
The page should be simple, romantic-themed, and have only one purpose: to ask her to be my Valentine
There should be two options: Yes or No

acceptanceCriteria: The main prompt text includes “Will you be my Valentine?” in English.
The name “Aqsa Kousar” appears on the page in a romantic context (e.g., greeting/header).
Only two primary action buttons are present: “Yes” and “No”.

requirements.text: Implement an evasive “No” button that moves away when the user attempts to interact with it so it is effectively not clickable on both desktop (mouse hover) and iPad (touch interaction).

quotes: When she hovers her cursor over No, it should move away so she cannot click it, forcing her to click only on Yes.

acceptanceCriteria: On desktop, moving the cursor over the “No” button causes it to reposition away from the pointer.
On touch devices (iPad Chrome), attempting to tap the “No” button causes it to reposition before a click/tap can be completed.
The “No” button never triggers a “No” selected state or confirmation UI.

requirements.text: When the user clicks “Yes”, transition the UI to show a meme image that visually includes the text “Good choice” and display a clear confirmation state (e.g., hide the buttons or disable further interaction).

quotes: When she clicks Yes, show her a meme image telling her "Good choice

acceptanceCriteria: The meme image visibly contains the words “Good choice” (as part of the image).
After “Yes” is clicked, the Yes/No choice UI is no longer actionable (buttons removed or disabled).

requirements.text: Apply a romantic pink-and-white visual theme across the page (background, typography, buttons, spacing) and ensure the layout is responsive and works well in Chrome on iPad.

quotes: The page should be themed romantically with a pink and white color scheme and be fully interactive ... so that I can easily run it on my iPad using Chrome.

acceptanceCriteria: The primary palette is pink and white; the look and feel is clearly romantic-themed.
The page layout remains usable and visually coherent on an iPad-sized viewport in Chrome.
All interactions (evasive No, Yes reveal) work without requiring page reloads.

requirements.text: Add the generated meme image as a static frontend asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and load it directly from the frontend (not via the backend).
acceptanceCriteria: The meme image file exists under frontend/public/assets/generated.
The app references the image via a static path and displays it on “Yes”.
No backend endpoints are added for image delivery.

constraints: Use English for all user-facing text.
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable frontend paths specified by the platform.
Keep the experience single-page and focused only on the Valentine question flow (no extra app sections).
nonGoals: Backend canister features or persistent storage.
Sharing, social integrations, messaging, email, or notifications.

required: Romantic meme-style image with the words “Good choice” incorporated into the image (valentine-good-choice-meme.dim_1200x900.png)
